intro: Thlaspi virginicum, commonly known as the Virginia cabbages or yellow cabbages, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing, herbaceous perennial that typically reaches a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are alternate and often have a waxy coating. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in early spring. Thlaspi virginicum is native to North America and thrives in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and wet meadows.
